In this paper, we demonstrate how our system is constructed. Three parts of an article are extracted to represent its content. We incorporate two domain-specific resources, i.e., UMLS and a list of tumor names. For each categorization work, we propose an algorithm to get the best combination of the representations and train an SVM classifier out of this combination. Evaluation results show overall high performance in this study. Except for MeSH terms, we can try other sections in the article, e.g., Results, Discussions and Conclusions as targets of feature extraction besides the abstract and captions in the future. Finally, we will try to make use of other available domain-specific resources in hope of enhancing the performance of this system.
